page.title: 01COTSWOLD COUNTRY
page.content: The area around Dursley is bordered on three sides by the Cotswold Hills with its landscapes of green fields and wooded slopes and on the other by the Severn Vale with the river itself meandering from the Bristol Channel inland to Gloucester and beyond. Many areas of National Trust property are a testimony to the outstanding scenic beauty of this part of Gloucestershire. Cattle and arable farming cover most of this part of the county but farming certainly is not the largest form of employment. Small industries provide some employment within the area but the majority travel to their place of work at Bristol, Gloucester, Stroud and Berkeley and Oldbury Power Stations.
